title: Aforhok
author: Aforhok
content: Hi everyone, please can someone put me through on how the forum works, because I can't find my way around it please. Thanks.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: Aforhok on June 07, 2023, 02:29:27 PMHi everyone, please can someone put me through on how the forum works, because I can't find my way around it please. Thanks.Hi, welcome to bitcointalk.Since you stated that you're a newbie then I'd suggest you go through the rules and regulations that has been laid down to help users understand and use the forum in the appropriate way. here's the link: Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQI'm not sure if you're a newbie in the forum or to bitcoin/crypto as a whole, but if the latter is the case then I will also suggest you checking out some few links as they will help you in your journey here. You need to engage in discussions here in the forum and to do that you must have some knowledge on that topic been discussed so do well to check out the following links;Mastering Bitcoin (GitHub)The Internet of MoneyMastering the Lightning NetworkMastering EthereumBeginners & Help Encyclopediahttps://bitcoin.org/en/how-it-worksThis should be enough to get you started and most importanty, don't forget to ask questions whenever you come across something you don't understand we have so many experienced and knowledgeable users here that are willing to help newbies like yourself understand more about bitcoin.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Welcome. How did you find your way here to the forum? Have you been evicted by aliens?What do you need to know in order for us to give you a referral? If you know how to read, then you will certainly find here the necessary and interesting information for you.

comments.author: tabas

The forum was built for everyone who's into Bitcoin and as well as other cryptocurrencies. You don't have to make it difficult for yourself if you can make yourself round about it. So that you are aware of what type of board you're in, I am sure that there's even at least one of them that will catch your attention and why you've decided to register because there's something interesting that you wanna ask and want to learn so enjoy on board.

comments.author: HajiBagi
comments.body: Quote from: Mahirap on June 07, 2023, 11:09:17 PMWelcome to the forum.I hope you find the rules and regulations shared by other members. You don't need to create a new topic to guide you here or someone to post rules and regulations here in your thread. You can find all the rules of their respective board in pinned thread so kindly read them before posting. You can learn many things from this forum if you are wiling enough to learn form the forum.really good advice, I'd like to add some additional advice. First, joining a forum does not guarantee that you will get what you want right away. Many newbies mistakenly believe that joining a forum and being promoted to a higher rank is very simple, which is why the majority of newbies complain about their lack of merit or inability to rank up. Similar to the forum, you must gain more knowledge about bitcoin because, from what I can see, many forum members do so in order to do so.However, if you come to the forum as a newbie thinking that you want to become wealthy or have money, you are mistaken. Although many forum members have money, you still need to study more to become successful. If you pay attention to many forum members who are higher than you, I'm sure you won't regret being here.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Like we all know learning is a continuous process so I am not surprised OP asking questions here as this is the only means through which one can learn new things when one ask questions.It is true that in every platform and even organizations, there are rules and guidelines governing them. Possibly policies that keeps them going. This is also applicable here and I believe from the posts and links provided in the previous post's but other members, OP can be able to navigate through the platform.OP should not this; that every thread or board has its own guidelines pinned at  the top of the thread so it would be in your own best interest to make sure you read them so as to get aquatinted with the boards very well.Do well to always attach your refference if you copied any post from anywhere so as to avoid being banned for plagiarism. For instance if you copy from the internet, you can paste the link from the source after you have made your write up.Lastly, as a newbie here, you must have come across so acronyms which you might be familiar with and those you have no idea about. Below you can read further to learn more of it;https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5455635.msg62370045#msg62370045I think all these put together would be of help to you in acquiring more knowledge about the platform and other activities going on here.Once again welcome onboard.

comments.author: Adams0001
comments.body: Hello and welcome to the forums. Simply obey the forum rules and regulations to prevent being punished in the forum, and don't submit needless posts here. And always ask questions if you don't understand something; there are many individuals here who can help you. After that, you can participate in discussions and provide answers to inquiries or illuminate the community about anything that will be useful to them. You've now begun contributing to the forum.

comments.author: ItsCrafty
comments.body: Quote from: DaNNy001 on June 08, 2023, 09:17:18 AMWelcome to the forum mate, Well I can see some members have already given great tips to start up your stay here in the community and if you want to grow and also improve your skills in bitcoin technology and the forum here you probably best follow those instruction and guidelines given to you.Yes, your advise is ideal for someone who is just getting started in the crypto world. We welcome to newbies on this forum who really want to learn and earn something else. There is no matter what you choose or how much you invest in if you have a sound understanding of crypto trading. However, if you have money and want to invest in trading, you need first learn and gain experience before making a decision. Because you cannot evaluate the behavior of the crypto market or generate money from it unless you have a thorough understanding of fundamental and technical analysis, risk assessment, and so on. So, do your research thoroughly and start with low-value tokens rather than high-value tokens. Furthermore, you must remember the loss first.
